dict.string: rate for nucleation (also known as nucleate[0])
type of fiber that is nucleated (also known as nucleate[1])
specifications of a new fiber activity (also known as nucleate[2]) i.e. growing, classic, dynamic or treadmilling
angle of newly made fiber, relative to mother filament for Nucleator in Couple

specifies the direction of the new Fiber. The specificity can be: off (default), parallel, antiparallel. With 'specificity=none', the direction will follow the value of 'orientation', specified within the spec nucleation[2].

defines if nucleator attaches to fibers that it creates [none, minus_end, plus_end]. Possible values for hold_end: off, plus_end, minus_end. Note that a nucleator remains innactive as long as it is bound to a fiber. Thus, setting hold_end = minus_end in combination with a detachment rate of zero will limit nucleation to one fiber at a time. (default value is minus_end)
If track_end is set to plus_end or minus_end, the hand will stay always positionned at the given fiber end, even if this end is growing or shrinking. Possible values are off, plus_end, minus_end.
if true, set the Dynamic State of the nearest filament end to STATE_RED (shrinking) upon detachment
